page.title: 08BRITISH RAIL:SHEFFIELD
page.content:
{ B.R.FREIGHT TERMINAL.
Situated on Brightside Lane this is the largest depot in the Eastern Region. The line running through it goes from Newcastle to Bristol, and many of the trains run straight through to Germany and Italy. 730 trains pass through in one year carrying anything but livestock. It handles, on average, 5,500 tonnes of steel a week.(4.6t.wire)
{ B.R.PASSENGER & GOODS TRAINS
There are two local B.R. stations, at{Attercliffe}and{Darnall.}The trains sometimes stop for comuters but most of the trains that pass through are goods trains. Attercliffe is on the old L.M.R.line and Darnall on the old Eastern Railway.
